primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God descends into the chaos of human rebellion and death to deliver humanity from the 'flood' of destruction through the specific person of Jesus Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: The eternal God... has come down from his throne
has submitted to the fury of its rebellion
has given his very self in order that we should be saved

object.identificatie: Deliverance from everlasting sin and death / Eternal Life
tekstueel_bewijs: to deliver us from everlasting sin and death

zender.identificatie: The Father / The Holy One of God
tekstueel_bewijs: the Father who sent me draws him
the only Son, who is in the bosom of the Father
in order that we should be saved
Except ye eat... ye have no life in you
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver who is currently 'helpless' or 'benighted'.

helper.identificatie: The Words of Jesus / The Holy Spirit (implied in the 'drawing')
tekstueel_bewijs: You have the words of eternal life
unless the Father who sent me draws him
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject (the actor) and Helper (the Word).

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, the 'Flood', and 'Religion' (as human projection)
tekstueel_bewijs: the domain of death and hell
the gods that we make for ourselves
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but the ontological reality of death and the 'flood' that obliterates human aspiration.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human struggle to remain in faith despite the silence of God and the reality of catastrophe.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Disciple / The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (believing) is presented as a response to the primary program (God's descent).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has come down from his throne
voorbeelden_mens_subject: many of his disciples drew back

voorbeelden: we too must do this (referring to the rescue workers' grim task)
Do you also wish to go away?
I do not know [why terrible things happen]
he has passed through the domain of death... emerged victorious

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' (Pouvoir) of God to act where human 'Religion' (Savoir/Vouloir) fails.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from ~S2 (Illusion/Need) to ~S1 (Religion as human effort), then confronts S2 (The reality of the TWA crash), finally resolving in S1 (The specific Revelation of the Cross).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by Christ entering S2 (Death) to establish S1 (Life).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the TWA crash is used to strip away 'cheap' theological answers.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly rejects anthropocentric 'religion' (human need/effort) in favor of a theocentric 'revelation' (God's act in history).

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: I find myself answering with Peter

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Active Subject of Salvation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The eternal God... has given his very self in order that we should be saved
Religion is a human construct... Such a god cannot deliver the goods.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Peter is not a model of strength, but a model of having nowhere else to go.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Peter is the 'Receiver' of the Word, not the 'Hero' of the faith.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of 'creating' faith; comfort in a power external to the self.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic undertones; faith is a response to being 'drawn' by the Father.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon perfectly integrates the horror of the TWA crash with the 'hard saying' of the Gospel.
spanning_punten: The tension between Freud's 'Illusion' and the 'Revelation' of Christ.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: emerged victorious, bearing the keys with him

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is implied in the 'drawing' of the Father but not explicitly named.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is linked to the 'flood' and 'rebellion'—a state of being lost rather than just making mistakes.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. God is the Subject of all redemptive verbs.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly low on Devoir (Ethics), which is appropriate for this specific text.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the focus on Pouvoir (God's power).

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Death/The Flood) is sufficiently terrifying.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon avoids the trap of 'therapeutic moralism' by grounding faith in the objective, historical, and cosmic act of God in Christ.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the TWA anecdote's pathos; Greimas shows that the anecdote serves to define the 'Opponent' as cosmic rather than psychological.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains John 6; Greimas shows how the sermon maps the hearer into the role of the 'Twelve' who are 'drawn' by the Father.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'Religion' is the 'False Helper' in this narrative structure.

volledige_subject_lijst: God (Subject) - has given his very self
Jesus (Subject) - has passed through the domain of death
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the concept of 'Need' to deconstruct human-centered faith before replacing it with God-centered revelation.
